intro: Poranthera piceoides, commonly known as the bluebells of the south, is a flowering plant native to southern California. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is often found in chaparral and coastal scrub habitats. It has small, ovate leaves that are covered in a fine, fuzzy texture. Poranthera piceoides is a short-lived perennial that plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
